articles.description: Former Oregon QB Robby Ashford, the No. 168 prospect in the 2020 class, transferred to Auburn on Monday.

articles.description: The Nebraska Cornhuskers have transformed their quarterback depth chart through the transfer portal, adding former Florida State Seminole Chubba Purdy to a group that includes former Texas Longhorn Casey Thompson.
articles.headline: QB Chubba Purdy chooses to transfer to Nebraska after leaving Florida State football program

images.caption: Senior Kai-Leon Herbert was the No. 99 prospect in the 2017 class. He opted out of the 2020 season and has mainly been a reserve for Miami.

images.name: Bama's Christian Harris jumps in front of Book's intended target for INT
images.caption: Notre Dame QB Ian Book tries to find TE Michael Mayer, but Alabama LB Christian Harris jumps in front for the interception.

articles.description: Alabama linebacker Christian Harris has announced he will enter the NFL draft.
articles.headline: Alabama Crimson Tide LB Christian Harris says he's entering NFL draft

article.description: — Jay Stanton ran for a season-high 134 yards with a touchdown, Samford's defense and special teams added scores and the Bulldogs defeated The Citadel 35-14 on Saturday.
article.headline: Stanton, defensive TDs help Samford top The Citadel 35-14
article.linkText: Stanton, defensive TDs help Samford top The Citadel 35-14
article.story: HOMEWOOD, Ala. -- — Jay Stanton ran for a season-high 134 yards with a touchdown, Samford's defense and special teams added scores and the Bulldogs defeated The Citadel 35-14 on Saturday. Stanton's 68-yard run gave Samford (4-5, 3-4 Southern Conference) a 14-7 lead in the second quarter and Montrell Washington added a 68-yard punt return for a touchdown for a 21-7 lead at halftime. In the third quarter, Demarcus Ware scored his second rushing touchdown of the game and Midnight Steward scored on a 94-yard fumble return. Quarterback Jaylan Adams led The Citadel (2-7, 1-5) with 23 rushes for 80 yards but was just 4-of-12 passing for 73 yards. He ran for both of the Bulldogs' touchdowns. Samford quarterback Liam Welch completed 12 of 17 passes for 118 yards. —-
